name: Fish Passage & Barrier Effects (longitudinal connectivity)
functionStatement: Continuous pathways for movement of water, sediment, and organisms support recolonization, maintain species diversity, and enable recovery after disturbance.
descriptionMarkdown:
Longitudinal connectivity and aquatic organism passage; barriers can limit recolonization, migration, and gene flow.
Presence and proximity of impoundments (dams/ponds/reservoirs) that can alter flow regime, sediment transport, temperature, and aquatic connectivity.
methodContextMarkdown:
Context: Channel and Watershed

Method: Desktop (barrier inventory/imagery) with field verification where feasible
howToMeasureMarkdown:
Inventory potential barriers (culverts, dams, grade controls) within the specified upstream/downstream distance using barrier datasets and imagery; confirm passability where feasible. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.
Inventory impoundments upstream (and where specified, downstream) of the project reach using dam/impoundment datasets and imagery. Summarize proximity and/or density per the metric definition. Assign the condition class using the bin thresholds for this metric.

inputs.label: Fish Passage & Barrier Effects (longitudinal connectivity)
inputs.type: desktop (barrier inventory/imagery) with field verification where feasible
inputs.helpMarkdown:
Barrier inventories (state/federal/NGO), NHD/NHDPlus hydrography, recent imagery, and field verification where feasible.
ADF&G Web Mapper & Imagery
National Inventory of Dams (NID) and/or state dam databases; NHD/NHDPlus waterbodies/flowlines; recent imagery.

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No barrier within watershed OR barriers provide beneficial effect on project area and allows for aquatic organism passage. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: Barrier exists but does not adversely affect aquatic organism passage OR a small blockage exists that is creating a minor fish passage barrier. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: Aquatic organism barriers (including impoundment(s)) located within 1 mile upstream or downstream of project area has a negative effect on aquatic organism passage. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.29)
